Thursday, June 14, 2007























Space station computers working again
Russian computers that control the international space station's orientation and oxygen and water supplies were partly working again Thursday after failing the day before.
FULL STORY




















Mount Kilimanjaro
The snows of Mount Kilimanjaro have been diminishing for more than a century but probably not due to global warming.
FULL STORY






Whale shark death
Another whale shark died early Wednesday at the Georgia Aquarium, the second this year.
FULL STORY






Mars ocean
Geographical features on Mars probably are remnants of shorelines of an ocean that covered the planet at least 2 billion years ago.
FULL STORY






Space plane
European aerospace company EADS unveiled a model of a jet designed to take tourists into space.
FULL STORY
